Generation III.Ruby: The fin on Mudkip 's head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pok é mon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.
Generation III.Sapphire: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pok é mon will unleash its amazing power - it can crush rocks bigger than itself.
Generation III.Emerald: On land, it can powerfully lift large boulders by planting its four feet and heaving. It sleeps by burying itself in soil at the water's edge.
Generation III.FireRed: Its large tail fin propels it through water with powerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of its size.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its large tail fin propels it through water with powerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of its size.

Generation IV.Diamond: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation IV.Pearl: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation IV.Platinum: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its power can crush boulders. It rests by covering itself with mud at the bottom of a river.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its power can crush boulders. It rests by covering itself with mud at the bottom of a river.

Generation V.Black: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation V.White: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation V.Black 2: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation V.White 2: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.

Generation VI.X: Its large tail fin propels it through water with powerful acceleration. It is strong in spite of its size.
Generation VI.Y: To alert it, the fin on its head senses the flow of water. It has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: The fin on Mudkip's head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this Pokémon can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: In water, Mudkip breathes using the gills on its cheeks. If it is faced with a tight situation in battle, this Pokémon will unleash its amazing power—it can crush rocks bigger than itself.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Using the fin on its head, Mudkip senses the flow of water to keep track of what's going on around it. Mudkip has the strength to heft boulders.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Using the fin on its head, Mudkip senses the flow of water to keep track of what's going on around it. Mudkip has the strength to heft boulders.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It has the power to crush large boulders into pieces. To rest, it buries itself in mud at the bottom of a river.
Generation IX.Violet: When it uses its large tail fin, it picks up speed rapidly in the water. It is strong in spite of its small size.

Generation III.Ruby: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation III.Sapphire: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
Generation III.Emerald: First partner Pokémon from Professor Birch on Route 101
